task_summary: The robot grasps a cup, moves above a mug, aligns, pours the contents from the cup into the mug, and then retreats.

task_long_description.overview: This episode shows a robot arm performing a 'pour into the mug' task in a structured lab environment. The arm begins with a cup in its gripper, locates the mug on the table, moves the cup above the mug, aligns itself precisely, pours by tilting the cup into the mug, and finally retreats from the pouring position. The cup and mug are the key objects, with the robot pouring with controlled alignment; no grasping action is observed as the robot already holds the source cup.
preconditions: Robot starts with cup already in its gripper
Mug is placed and visible on the table
Cup contains the substance to pour
stepwise_plan: Verify visibility of cup and mug
Move above mug while holding cup
Execute pouring action from cup to mug by tilting 90 degrees
success_criteria: Contents transferred from cup to mug
Robot retreats to a safe position after pouring
failure_and_recovery: If mug not detected, re-attempt detection
If alignment fails, retry movement and alignment
If pour fails to start, reexecute pour action
task_long_description.termination: Robot has retreated and pouring is complete

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the cup is visible to ensure further manipulation is possible.
Attempts to detect the cup if not already visible.
Checks if the mug is visible to ensure pouring can proceed.
Attempts to detect the mug if not already visible.
Moves the gripper (with cup) above the mug to a safe pouring height.
Precisely aligns the cup (held) over the mug for accurate pouring.
Executes pouring by tilting the cup 90 degrees over the mug.
Retracts the arm from the mug after pouring is done.

recovery_strategy: Retry object detection if not found
Re-align and approach again if not properly positioned
Retry pour action if pour fails
assumptions: The robot begins with the cup already in its gripper; no grasp/pick phase is needed according to visual frames.
No explicit force or pour rate is provided by the instruction or seen in frames.
Object identities ('cup', 'mug') are inferred visually from the scene.
Pour amount is set to null due to lack of instruction and visual evidence.

expected_success_criteria: Cup is tilted to pour into the mug
No visible spillage on the table
